analogy: Oops! It looks like the restaurant telephone broke!
Since you are too broke to hire someone, you have to fix it yourself.
On further examination, it looks like the telephone is unable to make calls.
So, you must reprogram the telephone to make and take calls again.
To do that, you must learn how phone calls work:
(i) The caller must dial the recipient's number and wait for them to pick up, which will establish a direct line of communication between them.
(ii) When one person speaks, the other listens and acknowledges their understanding by responding.
(iii) If someone is speaking too quickly, or they cut off due to network issues or background noises, the other will ask them to repeat themselves.
(iv) When both parties are done talking, they will agree to hang up.
actual_logic: When a client communicates with a server for web pages and other information, they use the TCP protocol, which allows for reliable and connection-based communication.

(i) The client and server engage in a three-way handshake. First, the client indicates to the server that it wants to connect. Then, the server responds by acknowledging that request. Finally, the client acknowledges the response and a connection has been established.
(ii) During communication, TCP ensures reliable communication by using acknowledgment packets to confirm that messages have been delivered.
(iii) If data is being transmitted too quickly, or the network is congested, TCP will restrict transmission rates to ensure reliability.
(iv) When the server and client are done communicating, the TCP connection is terminated by mutual agreement.
explannation: First, the caller dials the recipient's number.
When the recipient picks up, the conversation begins.

When one person speaks, there are two branches: if the person speaks too quickly, the recipient will not follow, and the person needs to speak again; otherwise, the other will listen and acknowledge that they received the message.
If one of them hangs up, the conversation ends; otherwise, the conversation continues starting with one person speaking again.
